title: EVAOnline Validation Dataset: Kalman Fusion System for Reference Evapotranspiration in Brazil (1991-2020)
description: Complete validation dataset for EVAOnline, an open-source Kalman fusion system for reference evapotranspiration (ETo) estimation integrating 6 climate APIs (NASA POWER, Open-Meteo Archive/Forecast, Met Norway Locationforecast, NWS USA Forecast/Stations). This validation dataset evaluates ETo accuracy using two global reanalysis sources: (1) Xavier et al. BR-DWGD reference data (Brazilian Daily Weather Gridded Data, 1961-2024, 0.1° resolution, 3,625+ weather stations), (2) NASA POWER reanalysis (MERRA-2, 0.5° resolution), (3) Open-Meteo Archive (ERA5-Land, ~9km resolution), and (4) EVAOnline Kalman fusion results combining NASA POWER and Open-Meteo. Data covers 17 Brazilian cities in the MATOPIBA region plus Piracicaba (São Paulo) with 186,287 daily observations spanning 1991-2020. EVAOnline demonstrates superior performance with MAE=0.42 mm/day, PBIAS=0.71%, and KGE=0.814, significantly outperforming NASA POWER (MAE=0.84, PBIAS=15.78%, KGE=0.411) and Open-Meteo (MAE=0.86, PBIAS=13.02%, KGE=0.432). The hybrid Kalman fusion achieves 38.7-50.8% MAE reduction and 91.4-95.5% BIAS reduction compared to individual sources.

method: Daily ETo calculated using FAO-56 Penman-Monteith equation. Kalman fusion combines NASA POWER (MERRA-2 reanalysis, 0.5° resolution) and Open-Meteo (ERA5-Land reanalysis, ~9 km resolution) data with dynamic bias correction and covariance estimation. Validation against Xavier et al. BR-DWGD reference dataset (Brazilian Daily Weather Gridded Data, 0.1° x 0.1° resolution, 1961/01/01-2024/03/20, 3,625+ weather stations) using Brazil-specific limits (Temperature: -30 to 50°C, Precipitation: 0-450mm, Radiation: 0-40 MJ/m², Wind: 0-100 m/s). NASA POWER data accessed via API (https://power.larc.nasa.gov/api/), Open-Meteo via Historical Weather API (https://open-meteo.com/en/docs/historical-weather-api). Xavier et al. dataset: https://sites.google.com/site/alexandrecandidoxavierufes/brazilian-daily-weather-gridded-data
